alert.note: Alert for Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 11:37AM EDT until September 05 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Jackson and Transylvania. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated repeated heavy rain showers affecting the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and an additional inch is possible into this afternoon. - High water conditions occurring on Tanasee Creek Lake will cause further water level rises along Bear Creek and into the Bear Creek Lake Community. These rises and associated flooding may translate downstream to the Cedar Cliff dam area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cullowhee, Lake Glenville, Tuckasegee, Wolf Mountain and Balsam Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
